page.title: 04Clay Mining
page.content:
Ball clay has been mined in this area since the 18th century, when it was used for clay pipes. Originally owned by Pike Bros., it became part of {English China Clays}in 1971. With 200 employees working on mining and processing, it is an important local industry. Of the six workings here, half are underground and half open-cast - a cheaper system. Pits are backfilled as they are exhausted rather than, as previously, being left to fill with water.
Miners can indentify the best clay by chewing it. Clay from this region is no longer used as much for pottery, but is sold in powder form for the manufacture of tiles, sanitary ware, animal feed and even some chocolates!
